edge: Arthur Fleck, a failed clown and aspiring stand-up comedian, experiences mental illness and transforms into the menacing Joker.

The emergence of Joker inspires a violent countercultural revolution against the wealthy in Gotham City.

Joker was the highest-grossing R-rated film until being surpassed by Deadpool & Wolverine in 2024.

Joaquin Phoenix expressed interest in acting in a low-budget 'character study' type of film about a comic book villain, specifically DC Comics character the Joker between 2014 and 2015. However, he ruled out the Joker for his idea due to it being already portrayed by other actors.

Phoenix declined to act in the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) because he would have been required to reprise a role, such as Bruce Banner / Hulk or Stephen Strange / Doctor Strange, in multiple films.
Phillips had been offered to direct comic-based films a number of times, but declined because he thought they were 'loud' and did not interest him.
Phillips was attracted to the Joker because he did not think there was a definitive portrayal of the character, which he knew would provide considerable creative freedom.
Phillips pitched the idea for Joker to Warner Bros. after his film War Dogs premiered in August 2016.
During the premiere, Phillips realized 'War Dogs wasn't going to set the world on fire and I was thinking, 'What do people really want to see?'
Phillips was mostly known for his comedy films, such as Road Trip (2000), Old School (2003) and The Hangover (2009); War Dogs marked a venture into more unsettling territory.
Throughout opposition of '30 million people on Twitter'.
'How do I do something irreverent, but fuck comedy? Oh I know, let’s take the comic book movie universe and turn it on its head with this'.
After the successful release of Wonder Woman (2017), DC Films decided to deemphasize the shared nature of its DC-based film franchise, the DC Extended Universe (DCEU).
Scorsese considered directing Joker before Phillips was chosen, though a Warner Bros. source said he only became involved because the film needed a New York City-based producer.

Leto left his association with CAA, as he believed 'his agents should have told him about the Phillips project earlier and fought harder for his version of Joker'.
Leto asked his music manager Irving Azoff to get the separate Joker project canceled, as he was 'alienated and upset' about it.

In their script, Phillips talked about how difficult it is for patients to reveal their diagnoses, referring to a line from the film: 'The worst part of having a mental illness is that people expect you to behave as if you don't'.
Phillips said that while the script's themes may reflect modern society, the film was not intended to be political. He also noted that Joker is a story about child trauma and mental illness.

Following the disappointing critical and financial performance of Justice League (2017), in January 2018 Walter Hamada replaced Jon Berg as the head of DC-based film production at Warner Bros. Hamada sorted through the various DC films in development, canceling some while advancing work on others; the film was set to begin filming in late 2018 with a small budget of $55 million.

The character Harley Quinn, who appears in both the Arkham Asylum and Arkham State Hospital, is a connection between them. In the comics, Arkham State Hospital serves as an alternative location to Arkham Asylum during times of crisis or overcrowding. This adaptation follows that tradition by introducing Arkham State Hospital as a replacement for Arkham Asylum in this film.

Warner Bros. Korea explained that the name 'Arkham State Hospital' is a more realistic and appropriate choice for the real world, implying that it has some level of recognition or association with Warner Bros.
The interior scenes of Arkham State Hospital in the film were shot at Metropolitan Hospital Center of Harlem, further highlighting its visual and architectural resemblance to a hospital.
The exterior scenes of Arkham State Hospital in the film were shot at Brooklyn Army Terminal, possibly due to its similarity in style and atmosphere to that of an abandoned mental institution.

In the first and last scenes of the film, a white wall is shown inside Arkham State Hospital. This wall creates an enigmatic visual contrast with the dirty yellow wall seen in another scene, possibly implying that Arthur Fleck was not actually in hospital the entire time, or that there is some sort of ambiguity or confusion surrounding his whereabouts.

In a scene of the film, Arthur runs with a medical report while being pursued by the security guards. During this chase sequence, a wall inside Arkham State Hospital is shown to be dirty yellow in color.

In the United States and Canada, Joker grossed $335.5 million in 2019, making it the sixth-highest-grossing film of that year. This surpasses many other major releases from 2019 such as Avengers: Endgame, The Lion King, and Frozen II.

node_2: second highest-grossing r-rated film of all time
edge: As of 2021, Joker is the second highest-grossing R-rated film in history, with a worldwide gross of $1.079 billion.

node_2: most profitable film based on a comic book
edge: Given its small budget and little decline in week-to-week grosses during its theatrical run, Joker is considered the most profitable film based on a comic book according to Deadline Hollywood's estimates. This title was previously held by Deadpool (2016).

node_2: first and only r-rated film to pass the billion-dollar mark until deadpool & wolverine in 2024
edge: At the time of its release, Joker was the first and only R-rated film to gross over $1 billion worldwide. This title was retained by Joker until the release of Deadpool 3 (expected in 2024), which will also feature Wolverine.
Compared to other major studio releases, Joker had a relatively small production budget. This factor contributed significantly to the film's profitability, as estimated by Deadline Hollywood.
Joker is the first October release to open to over $100 million, surpassing the record set by Venom (2018).

node_2: highest domestic gross for an r-rated film
edge: After 155 days, Joker's American theatrical run wrapped up on March 5, 2020, with a final gross of $355.5 million, making it the fourth-highest domestic gross for an R-rated film, behind The Passion of the Christ (2004), Deadpool and American Sniper (2014).
It went on to break Venom's record for having the biggest October opening weekend, finishing with a domestic total of $96.2 million.

In September 2019, Joker was awarded the Golden Lion, the festival's highest prize, at the 76th Venice International Film Festival.
The film received overall eleven nominations (including Best Picture) from the Academy Awards ceremony.
The film won the Best Actor (Phoenix) award at the 92nd Academy Awards.
The film won the Best Original Score award at the 92nd Academy Awards and at the 77th Golden Globe Awards ceremony.
The film was nominated for four awards at the 77th Golden Globe Awards ceremony, winning two.
The film was nominated for seven awards at the 25th Critics' Choice Awards, winning two.
Guðnadóttir became the first woman to win an original score Oscar since The Full Monty (1997) in 1998 for Joker's soundtrack.
The film won Best Actor in a Leading Role (Phoenix), Best Casting, and Best Original Music at the 73rd British Academy Film Awards.
depiction of the Joker in Joker has been described as reminiscent of those who commit mass shootings and members of the incel community due to its themes of mental illness.
Christina Newland of The Guardian concludes that Fleck is not an incel, but writes that incels are likely to relate to him.
Vejvoda, Hammond and Newland interpreted the film as a cautionary tale—society's disregard of those who are less fortunate will create a person like the Joker.

Stephen Kent, writing for the Washington Examiner, described Arthur Fleck as blending shared aspects of mass shooters and interpreted its message as a reminder that society is riddled with men like the Joker.

Writing in People's World, Chauncey K. Robinson said the film 'walks a fine line between exploration and validation' of Joker's character and is 'ultimately an in-your-face examination of a broken system that creates its own monsters.'
Some writers have expressed concern that Joker's sympathetic portrayal of a homicidal maniac could inspire real-world violence.

Michael Shindler contends (drawing on insights from Sigmund Freud and Jacques Lacan) that it is for precisely that reason that the film will, if anything, preemptively quell real-world violence by rendering 'the Flecks of the world into meek somnambulists'

node_2: film's depiction of psychology of a murderer
edge: Adrian Raine described the film's depiction of the psychology of a murderer as 'a great educational tool' in an interview with Vanity Fair.

node_2: factors in arthur's childhood such as parental abuse and loss and family history of mental illness
edge: Kamran Ahmed highlighted the factors in Arthur's childhood such as parental abuse and loss and family history of mental illness in the genesis of his condition.
American psychiatrist Imani Walker analyzed the Joker's apparent mental disorders and circumstances.
Imani Walker says of Arthur and others in poverty who have mental illness: 'We as a society don't even pretend that they're real people and that's what this movie is about. He never had a chance.'
Forensic psychiatrist Ziv Cohen criticized the film as misrepresenting the mentally ill as violent.
Ziv Cohen argued the film conflates psychopathy (a lack of conscience) with mental illness, thereby creating a false impression of the mentally ill as dangerous.
The director and co-screenwriter of Joker, Todd Phillips, has stated that Joker is 'certainly not a political film'.
The film's discussions regarding violence have led to a discourse about it, as expressed by Phillips.
Phillips has commented on political backlash to the film, stating that 'the far left can sound like the far right when it suits their agenda'.
Willmore wrote in Vulture that the film has 'impossible' and 'deliberately contradictory' politics.
During a Five Star Movement event in October 2019, Italian comedian and politician Beppe Grillo gave a speech wearing the Joker's makeup.
Candidate for governor of Chiba Prefecture, appeared on NHK with a Joker costume in 2021.
During the 17 October Revolution, a group of graffiti artists called Ashekm painted a mural of the Joker holding a Molotov cocktail.
During the 2019–2022 Chilean protests, the phrase "We are all clowns", which is adopted by Gotham City protesters in the movie, was written at the foot of a statue.

During the George Floyd protests, Argentine president Alberto Fernández compared the pictures of the protests to those seen in the film. In France, during the Yellow Vest Protests, firefighters donned Joker makeup holding placards.
